Package gears.sidescroller.world.core

Class WorldObject

java.lang.Object
gears.sidescroller.world.core.WorldObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
JsonSerializable, Collidable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractItem, AbstractMachine, MobileWorldObject
public abstract class WorldObject extends Object implements Collidable, JsonSerializable
The ObjectInWorld class represents an object physically present in an Area. It contains attributes and methods used by several otherwise unrelated classes. One primary point of interest with this class is the differences between index-space and world-space: The index-space coordinate of an object is the cell in a tile map that contains the upper-left corner of the object. Whereas the world-space coordinate of an object are the exact coordinates of its upper-left corner.

    • getCollisionBox

      public CollisionBox getCollisionBox()
      Creates a CollisionBox for the ObjectInWorld. Note that you should not cache this CollisionBox if the coordinates or size of this object can change, as the CollisionBox doesn't track changes to the object it represents.
      Specified by:
      getCollisionBox in interface Collidable
      Returns:
      a hitbox for this.
